cvmx-helper-board.c File Reference

Helper functions to abstract board specific data about network ports from the rest of the cvmx-helper files. More...

Detailed Description

Helper functions to abstract board specific data about network ports from the rest of the cvmx-helper files.

Define Documentation

int __cvmx_helper_board_hardware_enable ( int  interface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Enable packet input/output from the hardware. This function is called after by cvmx_helper_packet_hardware_enable() to perform board specific initialization. For most boards nothing is needed.

Parameters:
interface Interface to enable
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
int __cvmx_helper_board_interface_probe ( int  interface,
int  supported_ports 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This function is called by cvmx_helper_interface_probe() after it determines the number of ports Octeon can support on a specific interface. This function is the per board location to override this value. It is called with the number of ports Octeon might support and should return the number of actual ports on the board.

This function must be modified for every new Octeon board. Internally it uses switch statements based on the cvmx_sysinfo data to determine board types and revisions. It relies on the fact that every Octeon board receives a unique board type enumeration from the bootloader.

Parameters:
interface Interface to probe
supported_ports Number of ports Octeon supports.
Returns:
Number of ports the actual board supports. Many times this will simple be "support_ports".
cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_board_link_get ( int  ipd_port  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This function invokes __cvmx_helper_board_link_get_from_dt when device tree info is available. When the device tree information is not available then this function is the board specific method of determining an ethernet ports link speed. Most Octeon boards have Marvell PHYs and are handled by the fall through case. This function must be updated for boards that don't have the normal Marvell PHYs.

This function must be modified for every new Octeon board. Internally it uses switch statements based on the cvmx_sysinfo data to determine board types and revisions. It relies on the fact that every Octeon board receives a unique board type enumeration from the bootloader.

Parameters:
ipd_port IPD input port associated with the port we want to get link status for.
Returns:
The ports link status. If the link isn't fully resolved, this must return zero.
cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_board_link_get_from_dt ( int  ipd_port  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This function is used ethernet ports link speed. This functions uses the device tree information to determine the phy address and type of PHY. The only supproted PHYs are Marvell and Broadcom.

Parameters:
ipd_port IPD input port associated with the port we want to get link status for.
Returns:
The ports link status. If the link isn't fully resolved, this must return zero.
cvmx_helper_board_usb_clock_types_t __cvmx_helper_board_usb_get_clock_type ( void   ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Gets the clock type used for the USB block based on board type. Used by the USB code for auto configuration of clock type.

Returns:
USB clock type enumeration
int __cvmx_helper_board_usb_get_num_ports ( int  supported_ports  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Adjusts the number of available USB ports on Octeon based on board specifics.

Parameters:
supported_ports expected number of ports based on chip type;
Returns:
number of available usb ports, based on board specifics. Return value is supported_ports if function does not override.
int __cvmx_helper_get_los ( int  xiface,
int  index 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Return loss of signal

Parameters:
xiface xinterface number
index port index on interface
Returns:
0 if signal present, 1 if loss of signal.

: A result of 0 is possible in some cases where the signal is not present.

This is for use with __cvmx_qlm_rx_equilization

static int __get_muxed_mdio_info_from_dt ( cvmx_phy_info_t *  phy_info,
int  mdio_offset,
int  mux_offset 
) [static]

Parse the muxed MDIO interface information from the device tree.

Parameters:
phy_info - pointer to phy info data structure to update
mdio_offset - offset of MDIO bus
mux_offset - offset of MUX, parent of mdio_offset
Returns:
0 for success or -1
int __get_phy_info_from_dt ( cvmx_phy_info_t *  phy_info,
int  ipd_port 
)

Return the MII PHY address associated with the given IPD port.

The phy address is obtained from the device tree.

Parameters:
[out] phy_info - PHY information data structure updated
ipd_port Octeon IPD port to get the MII address for.
Returns:
MII PHY address and bus number, -1 on error, -2 if PHY info missing (OK).

int cvmx_helper_board_get_mii_address ( int  ipd_port  ) 

Return the MII PHY address associated with the given IPD port.

A result of -1 means there isn't a MII capable PHY connected to this port. On chips supporting multiple MII busses the bus number is encoded in bits <15:8>.

This function must be modified for every new Octeon board. Internally it uses switch statements based on the cvmx_sysinfo data to determine board types and revisions. It replies on the fact that every Octeon board receives a unique board type enumeration from the bootloader.

Parameters:
ipd_port Octeon IPD port to get the MII address for.
Returns:
MII PHY address and bus number or -1.
int cvmx_helper_board_get_mii_address_from_dt ( int  ipd_port  ) 

Return the MII PHY address associated with the given IPD port.

The phy address is obtained from the device tree.

Parameters:
ipd_port Octeon IPD port to get the MII address for.
Returns:
MII PHY address and bus number or -1 on error, -2 if phy info missing (OK).

Currently only the Cortina CS4321 PHY needs this.

int cvmx_helper_board_link_set_phy ( int  phy_addr,
cvmx_helper_board_set_phy_link_flags_types_t  link_flags,
cvmx_helper_link_info_t  link_info 
)

This function as a board specific method of changing the PHY speed, duplex, and auto-negotiation.

This function as a board specific method of changing the PHY speed, duplex, and autonegotiation.

This programs the PHY and not Octeon. This can be used to force Octeon's links to specific settings.

Parameters:
phy_addr The address of the PHY to program
link_flags Flags to control auto-negotiation. Bit 0 is auto-negotiation enable/disable to maintain backward compatibility.
link_info Link speed to program. If the speed is zero and auto-negotiation is enabled, all possible negotiation speeds are advertised.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
int cvmx_helper_phy_register_mod_abs_changed ( int  xiface,
int  index 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Figure out which mod_abs changed function to use based on the phy type

Parameters:
xiface xinterface number
index port index on interface
Returns:
0 for success, -1 on error

This function figures out the proper mod_abs_changed function to use and registers the appropriate function. This should be called after the device tree has been fully parsed for the given port as well as after all SFP slots and any Microsemi VSC7224 devices have been parsed in the device tree.

static int cvmx_is_cortina ( const struct cvmx_phy_info *  phy_info  )  [static]

Return if the phy device is a Cortina multi-slice phy or a single slice.

Parameters:
[in] phy_info Pointer to phy information
Returns:
1 for multi-slice, 2 for single slice, 0 for non-cs4343 device

CVMX_SHARED cvmx_helper_link_info_t(* cvmx_override_board_link_get)(int ipd_port) = NULL

cvmx_override_board_link_get(int ipd_port) is a function pointer.

It is meant to allow customization of the process of talking to a PHY to determine link speed. It is called every time a PHY must be polled for link status. Users should set this pointer to a function before calling any cvmx-helper operations.

const int device_tree_dbg = 0 [static]

Set this to 1 to enable lots of debugging output.
